The incidents attending the fighting between the

Mataafa, the contending claimants for the Samoan

throne, have filtered through to this colony in a

desultory fashion It is quite true that the leading

incidents of the incipient war amongst the Samoans,

and the firm stand taken by Captain Sturdee and his

blue jackets from H M S Porpoise, have been detailed

by our correspondent at Apia, but other in

clements occurred on the fringe of the struggle,
